intro: Dianthus moesiacus, commonly known as the Moesia carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and sturdy, branching stems. Its flowers are arranged in dense clusters, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Dianthus moesiacus thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, preferring cooler climates.
